document_title: Intestinal infections: Symptoms, causes and prevention
subsection_name: nhiem-trung-duong-ruot.json_8_Frequently asked questions about intestinal infections
subsection_content:
1. Is intestinal infection dangerous?
Intestinal infections are rarely dangerous for healthy adults. However, for the elderly and young children, the disease has the risk of prolonging and causing many serious complications if not treated early (kidney failure, anemia...).
2. Are intestinal infections contagious?
Intestinal infections caused by bacteria, viruses, and parasites have the risk of spreading from person to person during contact. Therefore, everyone needs to be very careful when relatives, friends, etc. around them are sick.
3. What fruit should you eat if you have an intestinal infection?
Below are some fruits that are beneficial for the digestive system, helping to increase beneficial bacteria in the intestines, thereby helping to significantly improve infections: (4)
Bananas: Bananas provide fiber, potassium, protein, vitamin B6, manganese, which are beneficial for digestion. In addition, the ingredients resistant starch and inulin also help strengthen the intestinal microflora, fight inflammation and maintain a healthy intestinal mucosa.; Bananas: Bananas provide fiber, potassium, protein, vitamin B6, manganese, which are beneficial for digestion. In addition, the ingredients resistant starch and inulin also help strengthen the intestinal microflora, fight inflammation and maintain a healthy intestinal mucosa.
Peaches: Peaches are rich in antioxidants, vitamin C, fiber, which help support digestion, fight inflammation and boost immunity.; Peaches: Peaches are rich in antioxidants, vitamin C, and fiber, which help support digestion, fight inflammation, and boost immunity.
Apples: Apples are a source of antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals that are beneficial for the digestive system, including infections.; Apples: Apples are a source of antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals that are beneficial for the digestive system, including infections.
Cranberries: Cranberries are rich in antioxidants, help fight inflammation, prevent free radicals, and effectively help improve infections.; Cranberries: Cranberries are rich in antioxidants, help fight inflammation, prevent free radicals, and effectively help improve infections.
Pomegranate: Pomegranate is rich in antioxidants and prebiotic polyphenols, supporting the growth of Bifidobacterium and Lactobacillus bacteria, which are beneficial for the intestines.; Pomegranate: Pomegranate is rich in antioxidants and prebiotic polyphenols, supporting the growth of Bifidobacterium and Lactobacillus bacteria, which are beneficial for the intestines.
Fruits with lots of water (oranges, grapefruits, etc.). When drinking, you can add a little salt to help replenish water, electrolytes, vitamins.; Fruits with lots of water (oranges, grapefruits, etc.). When drinking, you can add a little salt to help replenish water, electrolytes, and vitamins.
In addition, when it comes to diet for intestinal infections, the first important thing is to drink plenty of water to avoid dehydration. After that, the patient should follow the BRAT food regimen (bananas, rice, applesauce, and toast). Milk, dairy products, fats, alcohol... are food groups that should be avoided because they can make symptoms worse.
